title: Ulverston to Coniston Walking Route
description: This is the first leg of the Cumbria Way taking you from Ulverston to Coniston. The walk first heads towards the village of Gawthwaite before continuing onto the beautiful Coniston Water. You then follow the footpath along the lake taking you into the village of Coniston. Other highlights on this section are splendid views of the 2634 foot high Old Man of Coniston Fell while Grizedale Forest is also visible for much of the walk.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: At nearby Torver you can pick up the Banishead Quarry Walk. This picturesque area includes nice trails along the Torver Beck and old slate quarries with a pretty pool and waterfall.

display_address: Gill Banks, Ulverston, Westmorland and Furness, England, LA12 7BU, United Kingdom
